How to Install masqmail on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • masqmail

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install masqmail on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing masqmail on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall masqmail in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install masqmail, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install masqmail Using apt

To install masqmail in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install masqmail using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install masqmail

The installation of masqmail might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install masqmail Using apt-get

To install masqmail using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install masqmail.

sudo apt-get -y install masqmail

Install masqmail Using Synaptic

To install masqmail using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install masqmail on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for masqmail. This will display the masqmail package in the package window, now to install masqmail, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the masqmail package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of masqmail.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install masqmail Using aptitude

To install masqmail on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of masqmail.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install masqmail using the command aptitude install masqmail.

sudo aptitude -y install masqmail

How to Upgrade masqmail on debian

If you want to upgrade the masqmail package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade masqmail using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade masqmail to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade masqmail.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade masqmail sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade masqmail

Upgrade masqmail using Aptitude

To upgrade masqmail using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade masqmail.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade masqmail

Upgrade masqmail using Synaptic

To upgrade masqmail using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for masqmail, now right-click masqmail, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade masqmail just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall masqmail on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall masqmail from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just masqmail, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove masqmail

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of masqmail

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of masqmail you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge masqmail

Remove masqmail using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall masqmail using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for masqmail, right-click the masqmail package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall masqmail click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install masqmail on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade masqmail using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of masqmail then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
